title: Hitler: the road to revenge
creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, New York Times Productions and Don Thompson
brief_description: Shows how Hitler’s personality, and the social, political and economic conditions in the 1930’s, played a large role in his rise to power. Also indicates the means by which he achieved power: mass psychology, propaganda and physical violence. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
